title: Family Advocate for Family Enrichment Center
description:
**THE ORGANIZATION**

Jacob A. Riis Neighborhood Settlement (Riis Settlement), a community-based non-profit organization offering comprehensive services to the youth, adults, older adults, immigrants and families of Western Queens, is dedicated to civic engagement and organizing as integral to our mission “to build and strengthen underserved communities and act as a catalyst for change.” For more information about Jacob A Riis Neighborhood Settlement, please view our website at www.riissettlement.org.

**ABOUT THE FAMILY ENRICHMENT CENTER (FEC)**

Supported by funding from the New York City Administration for Children Services (ACS) and the Division of Child and Family Well-Being (CFWB), the Family Enrichment Center (FEC) in Astoria will create a welcoming environment where community members can come together. The center offers a safe space for residents to connect, learn, and access essential resources for the betterment of families and individuals alike. Serving as a hub for support, FECs not only reflect the unique essence of the neighborhood but also provide direct assistance and valuable resources. What makes FECs special is their focus on community involvement; families actively participate in shaping the centers' activities and initiatives. By fostering connections and empowering residents, the FEC will contribute to the overall well-being and resilience of the Astoria community.

**JOB SUMMARY**

The FEC Family Advocate will be dedicated to cultivating strong relationships with FEC staff, community partners, and key stakeholders. This role is pivotal in ensuring effective collaboration and support for families served by the FEC. Success in this position hinges on an engaging and empathetic communication style. By building these essential connections, the Family Advocate will help enhance the support network and resources available to families, furthering the FEC's mission to empower and uplift the community.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**

***Major Duties and Responsibilities***

* Responsible for supporting the daily operations of the FEC, including co-developing and implementing programs, offering direct advocacy for members, making referrals, and establishing a warm and inviting community space.
* Greet new arrivals, proactively seek out volunteers, and make sure they feel like valued team members.
* Organize, assist, and work alongside a team of local parents to host monthly events.
* Coordinate communication and collaboration with community partners to enhance program offerings and resources.
* Assist in tracking and reporting on program outcomes and member satisfaction to ensure continuous improvement and effective service delivery.

**STATEMENT OF SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:**

* An Associate’s Degree in social work, public policy, education, public administration, or related field; and/or equivalent experience.
* Bilingual preferred (English and Spanish, Mandarin, Greek, or Bengali)
* Lived and/or worked in Astoria or western Queens area preferred.
* Strong interpersonal skills to connect with and engage children, youth, and families.
* Experienced in data entry, generating reports, and making data-driven program decisions.
* Excellent organizational skills with experience in event planning or a similar capacity.
* Warm, outgoing, and enthusiastic, with the ability to positively impact diverse groups.
* Team oriented, skilled at engaging commitment and promoting cooperation.
* Experience in community organizing, political campaigns, and customer service.

**Benefits:**

* Generous Paid Time Off package of 12 holidays, 12 sick days, 10 days of vacation, and 6 personal days.
* Retirement plan with 50% employer match up to 6% of total salary
* Student Loan Assistance and Education Assistance
* Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
* EAP Services

Jacob A. Riis Neighborhood Settlement is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 403(b)
* 403(b) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Ability to Relocate:

* Queens, NY 11101: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Executive Assistant, Investment
description:
**COMPANY OVERVIEW**



Global Atlantic Financial Group is a leading insurance company meeting the retirement and life insurance needs of individuals and institutions. With a strong financial foundation and risk and investment management expertise, the company delivers tailored solutions to create more secure financial futures. The company's performance has been driven by its culture and core values focused on integrity, teamwork, and the importance of building long-term client relationships. Global Atlantic is a wholly-owned subsidiary of KKR, a leading global investment firm. Through its relationship, the company leverages KKR's investment capabilities, scale and access to capital markets to enhance the value it offers clients. KKR's parent company is KKR & Co. Inc. (NYSE: KKR).


**The Global Atlantic & KKR Partnership Story**



**Greenhouse is our scheduling tool, and we communicate through their systems. At times, your email may block our communications. Please be sure to check your SPAM so that you do not miss critical information about our process, including scheduling.**

 **POSITION OVERVIEW**



Global Atlantic Financial Group is seeking an Executive Assistant to provide high-level, dedicated administrative support to our two Co-Chief Investments Officers. Key duties include managing the busy schedules of multiple senior leaders, arranging domestic and international travel, preparing expense reports, and taking on a variety of additional tasks and projects as requested. Professionalism, flexibility, teamwork, strong organizational skills, effective communication, and the ability to work efficiently under pressure are all critical to this role.



This role requires a minimum of 4 days per week in our NYC office in Hudson Yards.


**POSITION SUMMARY**


*Communication and Information Management:*


* Monitor heavy and fluctuating calendars, high volume of calls, e-mails, and flow of communication.
* Compose, draft, proof, edit, and finalize correspondence including e-mail and other documents.
* Screen all calls for executives and handle all inquiries within capacity.
* Track Executives' meetings, as well as necessary follow up
* Review incoming mail and/or email, prioritize and summarize content, and process replies on own initiative or from executive's notes and directives.
* Plan and coordinate monthly and weekly team meetings as requested.
* Familiarity with Global Atlantic policies as outlined in the handbook and on-line, including but not limited to, travel, personal stock, IT, and record retention.
* Execute and manage both recurring and ad hoc projects such as database management, research requests and maintenance of information packages.


*Planning:*


* Handle planning logistics for complex domestic and international trips using the Firm's contracted travel agency; provide detailed itineraries, agendas, directions, and backup materials.
* Prepare expense reports in timely manner ensuring accuracy and submit in accordance with Firm policy.
* Monitor executive's calendars and anticipate where problems might arise regarding calendar, meeting preparation, needs of executives involved, requests for meetings and telephone calls; communicate potential and/or confirmed changes to involved parties immediately.
* Schedule and coordinate complex meetings and executive events requiring detailed logistics handling and problem solving, inform attendees of dates and time, reserve meeting space, ensure the appropriate equipment/materials are available, coordinate hospitality services as needed; assist with various company off-site meetings as requested in an upbeat and professional manner.


*Collaboration and Teamwork:*


* Liaise with parent company and related organizations, investors, guests, and all Global Atlantic personnel in a professional and courteous manner adhering to our culture and values.
* Act in a discreet and professional manner with others; sensitivity to the confidential nature of the Firm's business and consistently uphold such confidences and use this information only in the course of performing your job for Global Atlantic.
* Act as a team player, including taking on additional tasks to support colleagues and the Firm and offering to help before being asked; give credit where credit is due.
* Contribute your talents and efforts to a productive, pleasant, and safe working environment.
* Assist and provide phone and calendar coverage for additional executives when necessary.
* Assist Global Atlantic guests with general office support and reservations (travel, dinner, and local transportation, etc).


**IDEAL EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS**


* Bachelor's degree preferred
* 3+ years of experience in a professional administrative function supporting executives within the financial services or insurance
* Technically proficient; Advanced computer skills using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook); able to quickly and accurately produce/edit spreadsheets and presentations.
* Ability to manage highly sensitive, confidential information with complete discretion.
* Demonstrates good judgement; skilled at developing and maintaining relationships representing Global Atlantic in a professional manner
* Ability to manage a high volume of work, prioritize tasks and projects according to what is most time-sensitive. Strong attention to detail.
* Sense of urgency; ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and flexible attitude when responding to changes.
* Self-motivated; proactively identify areas for improvement to better streamline team workflow; can think "outside of the box."
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills; presents ideas clearly and communicates openly and effectively with team; facilitate multi-directional information flow.
* Team player who can work collaboratively or make decisions quickly and independently as needed.
* Ability to perform general office duties including opening mail, printing, collating materials, photocopying, faxing, and mailing materials.


\\*\\*\\* ***This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship now or in the future.***

title: Program Analyst, Bank Financing & Investor Relations
description:
**COMPANY OVERVIEW**



Global Atlantic Financial Group is a leading insurance company meeting the retirement and life insurance needs of individuals and institutions. With a strong financial foundation and risk and investment management expertise, the company delivers tailored solutions to create more secure financial futures. The company's performance has been driven by its culture and core values focused on integrity, teamwork, and the importance of building long-term client relationships. Global Atlantic is a wholly-owned subsidiary of KKR, a leading global investment firm. Through its relationship, the company leverages KKR's investment capabilities, scale and access to capital markets to enhance the value it offers clients. KKR's parent company is KKR & Co. Inc. (NYSE: KKR).


**The Global Atlantic & KKR Partnership Story**



**Greenhouse is our scheduling tool, and we communicate through their systems. At times, your email may block our communications. Please be sure to check your SPAM so that you do not miss critical information about our process, including scheduling.**

 **Company Overview:**



Global Atlantic is one of the fastest growing companies in the Life and Annuity industry. We are focused on the U.S. retirement and life insurance markets with a broad range of annuities and life insurance options, as well as reinsurance solutions. Our success is based on competitive and innovative product designs, leading investment management and integrated risk management, along with highly experienced leadership.



Global Atlantic is looking for a diverse team of talented people who support our culture of collaboration and innovation. Our unique entrepreneurial culture encourages all employees to assume significant levels of responsibility. We are dedicated to the career development of our people because we know they are critical to our long-term success. Join our team and come grow with us.


**Position Overview:**



We have a unique opportunity for a Program Analyst to join our New York based Treasury/Capital Markets team, a group that is charged with executing Global Atlantic's firmwide financing strategy and communicating our performance to investors. This individual will support the analysis, evaluation and communication of the company's financing strategy as well as support our investor engagement efforts alongside KKR.



Responsibilities will include:


* Assist in the execution of Global Atlantic's capital management strategy, including supporting the development, analysis and structuring of debt solutions for our sponsored third-party capital vehicles.
* Develop marketing materials for current / prospective investors or lenders.
* Establish and maintain third-party relationships, including through the development of quarterly firm-wide bank relationship materials, board materials and other ad-hoc investor deliverables.
* Drive transaction processes by managing due diligence & KYC requests, maintaining data rooms, coordinating with internal and external stakeholders, as well as negotiating legal documents (e.g., credit agreements, reimbursement agreements, etc.).
* Conduct industry research and peer analysis, including maintaining knowledge of financial markets and industry environment. Distill findings for senior management, with a focus on the impact to the firm's relative performance and lending needs.
* Develop a deep understanding of Global Atlantic's financial and operational profile and help identify opportunities for strategic development across all aspects of the company.
* Build relationships with internal functional groups, including investments, legal, finance, tax and reinsurance.


**Qualifications**


* Bachelor's degree (progress towards CFA is a plus).
* 1-2 years total work experience preferred. Prior work experience in financial services or consulting, in particular involving financial analysis, corporate banking, or capital markets.
* Knowledge of financial services industry and related products.
* Experience in financing transactions, with a focus on financial modeling and due diligence are a plus but not required.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. High attention to detail and strong analytical skills to present business trends in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
* Experience communicating with senior leadership, clients and/or institutional investors.
* Strong judgment, professionalism and ability to work effectively in challenging, fast-paced environment.
* Team-oriented, energetic self-starter with a positive attitude. Our firm is growing, and we need an ambitious and adaptable individual to support our Treasury/Capital Markets team.
* ***This role is not eligible for visa*** ***sponsor******ship now or in the future.***

title: Plant Manager
description:
**Overview:**

Alpha Metalcraft Group (AMG), is a leading manufacturing platform providing mission critical components to the aerospace, defense, and medical markets. AMG is a multi-site manufacturing organization with facilities currently in Danbury, CT; Bethel, CT, and Commack (Long Island), NY. AMG has expertise in precision metal forming capabilities such as electroforming, deep drawing, CNC machining and other manufacturing processes serving OEM, Tier 1 and Tier 2/3 customers.

**Job Summary:**

The Plant Manager is responsible for overseeing the daily operations of the deep draw metal manufacturing facility, which operates on a one-shift schedule with approximately 50 employees. The Plant Manager will drive continuous improvement in operational efficiency, safety, quality, and cost, while ensuring the facility meets production targets and customer requirements. This role requires collaboration with multiple departments, including quality, maintenance, engineering, and supply chain, to implement and sustain an Operational Excellence roadmap.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* ***Leadership and Management***

· *Oversee day-to-day plant operations, ensuring production targets are met in alignment with safety, quality, and cost objectives.*

· *Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performance team that drives operational excellence.*

· *Foster a culture of accountability, employee engagement, and continuous improvement.*

· *Manage a workforce of 50 employees, ensuring alignment with company objectives and maintaining positive employee relations.*

· *Communicate production updates, KPIs, and strategic initiatives to senior leadership.*

* ***Operational Excellence Roadmap***

· *Lead the development and sustainment of the* ***Operational Excellence*** *roadmap, focusing on:*

· ***Daily Management****: Drive structured daily management processes, including performance tracking, KPI monitoring, and production issue resolution.*

·***Total Predictive Maintenance (TPM)****: Implement and sustain a TPM system to maximize equipment uptime, focusing on NC and robotics equipment reliability.*

· ***6S****: Develop and maintain 6S (Sort, Set in Order, Shine, Standardize, Sustain, and Safety) standards to ensure a clean, organized, and safe workplace.*

· ***Lean Leadership****: Embed Lean principles and practices throughout the plant, promoting continuous process improvements, waste reduction, and value stream optimization.*

· ***Environmental Health and Safety (EHS)****: Lead EHS improvement initiatives to ensure a safe and compliant work environment. Collaborate with EHS teams to meet all regulatory standards and drive proactive safety culture improvements.*

* ***ISO 9001 and AS9100 Compliance***

· *Partner with the Quality Manager to ensure ongoing compliance with* ***ISO 9001*** *and* ***AS9100*** *standards.*

· *Oversee internal audits, corrective actions, and ensure documentation and procedures are consistently reviewed and maintained.*

· *Implement and review Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to maintain high quality standards, reduce scrap, and eliminate rework.*

* ***Maintenance and Equipment Optimization***

· *Ensure that the Total Predictive Maintenance program is adhered to, reducing downtime and ensuring high levels of machine availability.*

· *Work with the engineering team to optimize machine setups, changeovers, and tooling to reduce cycle times and improve efficiency.*

* ***Budgeting and Cost Management***

· *Manage the plant’s operating budget, tracking costs, identifying areas for cost savings, and implementing initiatives to drive cost-effective operations.*

· *Collaborate with finance to monitor and control labor, materials, and overhead costs.*

* ***Continuous Improvement and Problem-Solving***

· *Lead and participate in* ***Kaizen*** *events and other continuous improvement initiatives.*

· *Use data analysis and problem-solving methodologies (e.g., root cause analysis, 5 Whys) to improve plant performance.*

· *Identify and implement process improvements in the manufacturing of deep draw products to enhance product quality, reduce cycle times, and improve efficiency.*

**Qualifications:**

* **Education**: Bachelor's degree in engineering, manufacturing, or a related field. Certification in Lean or Six Sigma is a plus.
* **Experience**:

· Minimum of 7 years of experience in a manufacturing environment, with at least 3 years in a management or leadership role.

· Demonstrated experience in deep draw metal manufacturing, including familiarity with NC (Numerical Control) machines and robotics.

· Strong knowledge of ISO 9001 and AS9100 standards and auditing processes.

· Proven experience leading Lean manufacturing initiatives and implementing operational excellence frameworks such as 6S, TPM, and EHS programs.

* **Skills**:

· Strong leadership and communication skills with the ability to motivate teams and drive results.

· Familiarity with ERP systems and data-driven decision-making.

· Experience in budgeting, financial analysis, and cost control.

· Proven track record of leading Operational Excellence initiatives and delivering measurable results.

· Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Bi-lingual in Spanish preferred.

· Strong knowledge of Lean manufacturing principles, Total Predictive Maintenance, 6S, and other continuous improvement methodologies.

· Proven track record of leading Operational Excellence initiatives and delivering measurable results.

· ISO 9001 and AS9100 audit results and compliance.

· Waste reduction, scrap minimization, and cost control.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a focus on data-driven decision-making.

· Knowledge of Environmental Health and Safety regulations and best practices.

· Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

· US citizenship is required for technical data access compliance.

**Work Environment**:  
This role is based in a one-shift manufacturing facility specializing in deep draw metal forming, using NC machines and robotics. The environment requires strong attention to detail, adherence to safety standards, and a commitment to continuous improvement.

This position offers an exciting opportunity to lead a highly skilled team and drive transformative change in a growing company serving the Aerospace, Defense and Medical industries.

**Why Join Us:**

At Alpha Metalcraft Group (AMG), we offer a dynamic and collaborative work environment where your talents and contributions are valued and recognized. Joining our team means being part of a forward-thinking organization dedicated to pushing the boundaries of possibility in precision engineering. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, as well as opportunities for professional development and career advancement. If you are a motivated and detail-oriented individual with a passion for manufacturing, we invite you to embark on an exciting journey with us and contribute to our mission of excellence. Apply today to explore the possibilities at Alpha Metalcraft Group (AMG)!

**Benefits:**

* Quarterly Profit-Share Bonus Plan
* Generous 401(k) plan that includes employer 3% safe harbor contribution
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance
* Supplemental financial protection insurance plans
* HRA
* Life Insurance and disability coverage (short/long term)
* Tuition reimbursement program
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Paid Holidays
* Employee referral program

**Employment Type:** Full-Time

title: Associate (Intern - Summer 2025), Aircraft Financial & Technical Services
description:
**Associate (Intern - Summer 2025), Aircraft Financial & Technical Services – Alton Aviation Consultancy**
**COMPANY INTRODUCTION**
Alton Aviation Consultancy is a specialized advisory firm focused on the aviation sector. Our global client base includes, among others, major private equity and institutional investors in aviation, airlines, airports, lessors, and aerospace manufacturers. As an independent advisory firm with no joint ventures, affiliations, or other business affiliations, we pride ourselves on offering our clients independent, objective counsel. At Alton, our purpose is to deliver the objective, data-driven guidance and insight our clients require to inform business strategies, allocate capital, prioritize resources, and manage risk. We are looking for bright and talented minds to join our Aircraft Financial & Technical Services team in New York.
**JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY**
**Who we are:**
Alton delivers cutting-edge advisory services that help our aviation and aerospace sector clients conquer challenges and grow. We are a global team of seasoned advisors focused on the aviation industry who are renowned for thought leadership, quantitative analytics, and innovative solution development. Equipped with an unrivaled understanding of the global aviation value chain - including aviation finance, airlines, aerospace, MRO and aftermarket, airports, mobility, and technology - Alton is at the forefront of helping industry players navigate the ever-changing global aviation market and make strategic decisions that yield long-term value.
**Job Overview:**
One key segment of the aviation market that Alton is focused on serving intensively is the aircraft leasing and financing industry. Our Aircraft Financial & Technical Services team provides comprehensive support in this market from strategy to transaction support to execution.
Associates from our group are responsible for the day-to-day analytical work within our team. Throughout your work with us, you will be working closely in tight-knit teams with Alton’s principals to apply commercial expertise and rigorous analysis to support aircraft and spare engine investments and financings. While a major focus is expected to be preparing aviation financing cash flow forecasts for aircraft being acquired, leased, financed, and sold, you will also participate in other tasks such as market research and data analysis. You will come to develop a deep understanding of aircraft investment mechanics and have a direct stake in supporting Alton’s aviation clients. Your job responsibilities will grow as you continuously hone your skillset, taking on successively greater responsibilities within the Aircraft Financial & Technical Services team to help deliver value to Alton’s clients on a daily basis.
The base salary range for this role is $85,000-$95,000.
**Job Responsibilities:*** Work as a member of the Aircraft Finance and Technical group on client engagements to gather, analyze, and interpret data to forecast how specific aircraft that are the subject of investment will be leased, operated and maintained, and the cash flows that will be exchanged by the airline and the owner of the aircraft during leases
* Conduct market research, and performing both quantitative and qualitative analyses (including financial model development)
* Contribute to the growth of the company in an entrepreneurial environment and support the development of company intellectual property


**QUALIFICATIONS**
**Educational Background:**  

Pursuit of a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in STEM or a similar discipline with demonstrated strong academic performance from a top educational institution.
**Qualities**:
* Strong interest in and passion for the aviation industry
* Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills
* High level of motivation and drive for excellence
* High level of focus on work quality and attention to detail
* Comprehension of finance fundamentals and strong analytical skills
* Proficiency Microsoft Excel and strong programming skills
	+ Proficiency with Microsoft VBA and/or Python is a strong positive
* Ability to perform under pressure and within tight deadlines
* Desire to work in a multicultural, diverse, and team-oriented environment
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English


**Travel:**Limited travel is anticipated to be required.
**HOW TO APPLY**
**Job Location:**
New York
**Application Process:**You must submit your resume and cover letter in English through our application portal on our website to be considered.
Applying through our website:
* Please visit our careers portal here: https://altonaviation.com/careers/


* Select the office you are interested in applying to and the position you are applying to (please only apply to one Alton job posting)


* Attach resume and cover letter, as well as your contact information


* Once you have completed the above, click “Submit” to complete your application

title: Strategist
description:
**About Schroders**



We’re a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future.



We have around 5,000 people on six continents. And we’ve been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn’t change is our commitment to helping our clients and society prosper.

  

**The Base**



We are based at 7 Bryant Park in the heart of NYC. And we have everything we need to work flexibly. We operate a hybrid working model, with a requirement that our Strategist be in the office 3 days per week. This is to sustain our culture of innovation, collaboration, knowledge sharing, and building relationships within the business

  

**The Team**



This is an opportunity to work interdependently with an engaged team that sits within a global Intermediary function at a global asset management firm.

  

**Position Overview**



Work closely with Schroders investment teams and Hartford Advisor Consultants (AC) and their internal advisor consultants (IAC) to position our investment strategies in a clear, compelling and convincing manner to a range of financial advisors. Excellent communication skills and expertise in our investment strategies as well as general capital markets insights are imperative as this position will have a high level of visibility, representing our investments and company to the financial advisor community in concert with Hartford Advisor Consultants. Individual should have proven results in sales within the intermediary channel and/or demonstrated success in a client portfolio manager role. Influences gross and net flows, strategic direction and develops tactical plans and completes complex assignments with substantial latitude for un-reviewed actions or decisions.

  

**Responsibilities**


* Collaboration and partnership with Hartford Advisor Consultants to generate FA level sales in Hartford Schroders funds with a target of achieving meaningful gross and net flows.
* Build compelling sales ideas to assist the Hartford Advisor Consultants in positioning our investment strategies.
* Continual interaction with Schroders investment teams to establish and maintain superior expertise across asset classes and ensure timely delivery of notable portfolio insights.
* Develop a plan to maintain constant information flow to Hartford Advisor Consultants within region - ensure Hartford team is highly educated on all aspects of Schroders strategies.
* Maintain expertise in capital markets to provide insight to Hartford Advisor Consultants while assisting in all aspects of the sales process.
* Collaborate in developing sales and target marketing campaigns and materials that are aligned with Hartford's organizational vision and strategies for growth.
* Ensure a properly maintained CRM.
* Help create new and update existing final presentations for Hartford.
* Coaches and mentors as appropriate, identifies training needs and assists in development programs.
* Prepare reports to ensure Schroders management teams are appropriately updated as to the success of partnership.
* Excellence in public speaking is required.
* Substantial travel, likely over 60% of the time.

  

  

**Basic Qualifications**


* Bachelors’ degree in Business, Finance/Economics, or math related field. Advanced degree or CFA preferred.
* 10 or more years’ experience in an investment environment, with emphasis on equity or fixed income products
* Heavy (50-60%) travel requirements
* Outstanding established writing and communication skills
* Strong math and analytical skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Strong Excel spreadsheet experience and excellent knowledge of Word and PowerPoint
* Must be very well organized and willing to learn

  

  

**Compensation**  

  

Schroders offers a base salary in a range of $200,000 to $230,000 for this position.



The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level.

  

**ADA**



Schroder Investment Management North America Inc. complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.

  

**We recognize potential, whoever you are**



Our purpose is to provide excellent investment performance to clients through active management. Diversity of thought facilitated by an inclusive culture will allow us to make better decisions and better achieve our purpose. This is why inclusion and diversity are a strategic priority for us and why we are an equal opportunities employer: you are welcome here regardless of your age, disability, gender identity, religious beliefs, sexual orientation, socio-economic background or any other protected characteristics

title: Assistant Portfolio Manager
description:
**About Schroders**



We’re a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future.



We have around 5,000 people on six continents. And we’ve been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn’t change is our commitment to helping our clients and society prosper.

  

**The Base**



We are based at 7 Bryant Park in the heart of NYC. And we have everything we need to work flexibly. We operate a hybrid working model, with a requirement that our Assistant Portfolio Manager be in the office 3 days per week. This is to sustain our culture of innovation, collaboration, knowledge sharing, and building relationships within the business

  

**The Team**



This is an opportunity to work interdependently with an engaged team that sits within a global Investment function at a global asset management firm.

  

**Position Overview**



The Assistant Portfolio Manager provides administrative, analytical and ESG support to portfolio managers on the US High Yield team. The focus of this role is bond allocation and strategy - ensuring that investment strategies are accurately implemented in the portfolios. A successful Assistant Portfolio Manager should develop into a contributor to the portfolio strategy formulation process along with interacting with analysts and senior PM’s on security selection decisions. For the right candidate this provides the potential of a path towards a fund manager position.

  

**Responsibilities**


* Support USHY portfolio team by providing general assistance in all aspects of the portfolio management cycle including daily tasks as well as long term projects
* Monitor portfolios’ position weights and risk analytics compared to benchmarks and targets. Highlight deviations and create orders to rebalance portfolios
* Bring special consideration to ESG factors and monitoring in addition to focusing on sustainability-linked strategies
* Monitor portfolio positions and trade orders for compliance with client guidelines
* Monitor and manage portfolio duration
* Manage portfolio cash balances and ensure cash balances are consistent with product guidelines and current investment strategy
* Coordinate with the trading desk on trading programs & monitor trade executions
* Review and resolve compliance breaches
* Monitor and coordinate corporate actions on behalf of the funds managed on the desk
* Take part in & develop action plan based in issuer and industry meetings with credit research team
* Work with Product team to provide portfolio and investment related information to clients in the form of presentations, written commentaries and responses to ad hoc requests
* Establish and maintain relationships with other departments internally, including Compliance, Sales, Marketing, and Investment
* Cultivate strong relationships with colleagues across the Global Credit and Fixed Income platforms

  

  

**Basic Qualifications**


* Bachelor’s degree
* 2-5 years’ experience in investment management
* Strong analytical skills
* Excellent verbal and written skills
* Personable and team-oriented
* Proficient in MS Office, Bloomberg

  

  

**Preferred Qualifications**


* Proficient in Aladdin
* CFA holder or candidate
* Coding experience Python, R, VBA

  

  

**Compensation**



Schroders offers a base salary in a range of $90,000 to $125,000 for this position.



The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level.

Schroder Investment Management North America Inc. complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.

title: Investment Grade Research Analyst
description:
**About Schroders**



We’re a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future.



We have around 5,000 people on six continents. And we’ve been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn’t change is our commitment to helping our clients and society prosper.

  

**The Base**



We are based at 7 Bryant Park in the heart of NYC. And we have everything we need to work flexibly. We operate a hybrid working model, with a requirement that our Investment Grade Research Analyst be in the office 3 days per week. This is to sustain our culture of innovation, collaboration, knowledge sharing, and building relationships within the business

  

**The Team**



This is an opportunity to work interdependently with an engaged team that sits within a global Fixed Income function at a global asset management firm.



The global investment grade team manages more than $50bn of assets across USD, Euro and Sterling strategies. We have a team of specialist portfolio managers who are supported by global research analysts.



As research-driven bond investors, we gain a performance advantage by using our large team of specialist analysts and portfolio managers to research ideas in their local markets. Idea generation is a key component of our success and therefore we are committed to operate a diverse, creative and smart team. Research partners with portfolio management to source alpha for clients.

  

**Position Overview**



Schroders is seeking an Investment Grade Research Analyst to join the US Fixed Income Research team. While there is flexibility for the right candidate, the role will generally focus on the analysis of Investment grade credits across a variety of sectors including but not limited to Capital Goods, Aerospace and REITs.

  

**Responsibilities**


* Perform fundamental analysis including modelling. Monitor performance and holdings relative to investment objectives, benchmarks and outlook.
* Produce both written and oral relative value recommendations.
* Develop and maintain sell-side research relationships, contact issuer management teams and attend industry conferences.
* Collaborate with other debt and equity analysts and portfolio managers as the credit expert on the covered industries.
* Frequently interact with portfolio managers and traders.
* Participates in periodic Industry Outlooks/Update and Thematic research sessions while utilizing the Data Insights Unit and the Environmental, Social and Governance resources.
* Meet with clients and prospects to discuss coverage themes and outlooks.
* Quickly respond to ad hoc credit requests.

  

  

**Basic Qualifications**


* Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, business, economics or related subject.
* Minimum of four years of investment grade credit research experience.
* Understanding of financial statements, capital structure, cash flow analysis, capital markets and portfolio management.
* Independent thinker with the ability to hold contrarian views.
* Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment with limited supervision.
* Strong communication skills.
* Proficient in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Capital IQ and Bloomberg.
* Personable, collegial and team-oriented.

  

  

**Preferred Qualifications**


* MBA and/or CFA/CPA. Actuarial, mathematical, engineering or computer science credentials and/or experience.
* Broad experience within the full spectrum of investment grade market.
* Experience working in an asset manager.
* Aladdin experience.
* Thomson Reuters Eikon experience.
* Willingness to develop new coverage.
* Sell-side and buy-side relationships.

  

  

**Compensation**  

  

Schroders offers a base salary in a range of $175,000 to $200,000 for this position.



The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level.

title: Private Equity Product Analyst
description:
**About Schroders**



We’re a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future.



We have around 5,000 people on six continents. And we’ve been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn’t change is our commitment to helping our clients and society prosper.

  

**The Base**



We are based at 7 Bryant Park in the heart of NYC. And we have everything we need to work flexibly. We operate a hybrid working model, with a requirement that our Private Equity Product Analyst be in the office 3 days per week. This is to sustain our culture of innovation, collaboration, knowledge sharing, and building relationships within the business

  

**The Team**



The Schroders Capital Private Equity Product Management team has responsibility for the development of new private equity funds, supporting new fundraising and working closely with Sales, Investment Management, Legal, Operations, as well Product teams from the other investment areas.



We manage new funds from inception, through to launch and the ongoing management and coordination of a fund during fundraising. It requires a versatile skillset which translates into work that is highly engaging and varied.



Schroders Capital Private Equity is based across multiple offices worldwide. The Product Management team is primarily based in Zurich, Switzerland but we also have a team member in London. We work closely with colleagues in other teams based in countries across the globe.

  

**Position Overview**



We are looking for a dynamic individual with 3-5 years of experience in private equity, especially in fund development, project management or business development.  

  

The person hired will have a strong work ethic with a collaborative approach to working with many people across different businesses. They will need to be well organized and have a problem-solving approach to the work. There will be high levels of responsibility, multi-tasking and often pressure to deliver in tight timeframes. Good communication skills are essential.



This is an excellent opportunity to gain considerable experience in private equity, the development of new funds and mandates, preparing marketing materials, coordinates sales campaigns and ultimately on-boarding and servicing investors when they become clients.

  

**Responsibilities**


* Support product business development efforts for the US market, including an evergreen private equity tender offer fund.
* Work closely with the Business Development and Sales teams to support fundraising efforts as well as client enquiries, RFPs and data room management.
* Lead on the development of marketing efforts and new materials for new funds, including initiatives to help promote private equity funds across institutional investors and wealth management partners
* Work in close alignment with Investment Management, Fund Operations, and Legal teams for the development and management of other private equity funds and mandates
* Prepare private placement memorandums (PPMs), pitch books, and other materials
* Prepare competitor information on products and investment strategies, including comparable performance data
* Review and oversight of sales pipeline and CRM systems (Salesforce) to ensure information is up to date and accurate for management reporting purposes

  

  

**Basic Qualifications**


* 3-5 years of experience in private equity, related asset classes or investment fund sales support
* Good understanding of Legal and Operational matters relevant to investment funds
* Good quality university degree and ideally some form of post graduate qualification such as MBA, CAIA, CFA, MSc
* Good verbal communication skills and ability to form good working relationships internally with colleagues in relevant teams as well as with third-party service providers and investors
* Excellent written skills for client communication and drafting of marketing materials
* Sound financial understanding and at least basic modelling skills
* Passion for Private Equity
* Execution oriented
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy
* Good at working in a team, and across teams within Schroders to service clients
* Fluent in English
* A good communicator – good written English skills
* Flexible, curious and willing to learn, with a strong work ethic
* Self-motivated and demonstrate initiative
* Organized, able to work under pressure, on several priorities at once, and with tight deadlines

  

  

**Compensation**



Schroders offers a base salary in a range of $110,000 to $120,000 for this position.



The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level.

Schroder Investment Management North America Inc. complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.

title: Manager, Paid Social
description:
As a channel manager on the Paid Social team, you will be managing the paid social campaigns for HelloFresh. You will be responsible for building and scaling cost-effective customer acquisition campaigns across major paid social channels for HelloFresh. You will help develop strategy and execute the campaigns, perform campaign trafficking, and use analytics to inform decisions and drive execution to optimize a significant marketing budget against company goals.



Additionally, you will work very closely with different teams, including growth, brand, data and CRM. It's an exciting role allowing you to develop as a future paid social leader of D2C growth as well as build one of the biggest food-tech brands in the world.


#### **You will…**


* Plan, design, and execute paid social (Meta, TikTok, Pinterest, Snapchat, etc) campaigns from execution to completion.
* Use a data-first approach to analyze performance drivers to optimize for channel ROI.
* Be responsible for all campaign trafficking, quality control, campaign launch, reporting, and analysis. This is a hands-on role building & optimizing campaigns.
* Optimize campaign performance towards activation, retention, and reactivation goals.
* Analyze & report on campaign KPIs to key stakeholders.
* Partner with internal teams to optimize campaign performance; e.g. Creative, BI, CRM, etc.—(targeting, optimization, creative direction, etc.)
* Develop relationships with key paid social partners to nurture performance growth
* Provide project management support to ensure deadlines are met
* Manage a set of external partners and contractors to maximize performance.
* Design, implement and analyze A/B split tests across paid social channels
* Work with Brand Team to oversee and launch paid social creatives.

#### **You are…**


* Experienced in leading efficient growth programs through a solid understanding of paid social and all performance marketing metrics (CPM, engagement rate, CPA, CPC & LTV)
* Experienced running large multi-million dollar growth campaigns on paid social media platforms including Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, TikTok, Reddit and Snapchat
* Strong communicator with presentation skills with an eye for creative performance.
* Quantitative & analytical; able to use data to optimize day-to-day performance
* Driven by process-improvement - helping teams become more efficient in our activities.
* Curious to not just know what is happening, but to understand why it is happening.
* Obsessed with growth and building things while not being afraid to get your hands dirty
* Familiar with the fast-paced, demanding and analytical startup environment
* Positive with a mindset towards challenges and new opportunities and a natural hustler with a contagious "can-do" attitude

#### **You have…**


* A bachelor's degree with a strong academic record and/or proven relevant experience in a performance marketing or highly commercial role.
* 5+ years of experience directly managing paid social campaigns on the client-side (preferred) or at a performance marketing agency.
* Must be proficient at Excel for performance analysis (pivot tables, formula building, etc)
* Knowledge of Facebook bidding, targeting, optimization, as well as web & app tracking setup and troubleshooting.
* Experience working with performance marketing metrics and platform reporting.
* Strong analytical ability and problem-solving skills. Able to use data to optimize day-to-day performance.
* Strong organizational skills and project management ability

#### **You'll get…**


* Competitive salary, 401k with company match that vests immediately upon participation, and company equity plan based on role
* Generous PTO, including sabbatical, and parental leave of up to 16 weeks
* Comprehensive health and wellness benefits with options at $0 monthly, effective first day of employment
* Tuition reimbursement for continuing education
* Up to 75% discount on subscriptions to HelloFresh meal plans (HelloFresh, Green Chef, Everyplate, and Factor\\_)
* Access to 7 different Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) including those for BIPOC, women, veterans, parents, and LGBTQ+
* Inclusive, collaborative, and dynamic work environment within a fast-paced, mission-driven company that is disrupting the traditional food supply chain


Position is eligible to participate, contingent on Supervisory Board Approval, in HelloFresh's equity program.



This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the responsibilities. However, the Company reserves the right to adjust, modify, or reassign work tasks and responsibilities as needed to meet changing business needs, operational requirements, or other factors.
company_description: HelloFresh is a global food solutions group and the world's leading meal kit delivery company, active in 17 countries across 3 continents. Our kits include fresh ingredients and cooking instructions.

title: Director of Engineering
description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Job Description

**The Director, Engineering & Support Services (Approved Specialties) directs the planning, coordination, and evaluation of the Systems' capital programs which include General Construction, Telecommunications, Energy Conservation, and other Engineering Support Programs. Implements processes and procedures to aid in the direction of trade staff, the management of capital projects, and other programs within the designated areas of authority.** 

**General tasks and responsibilities will include:** 

* Directs trade staff through the development of processes and procedures for the implementation of maintenance operations.
* Coordinates and recommends plans, designs, and changes in various construction, renovation, and engineering activities.
* Evaluates department's projects through the creation of reports, studies, and surveys detailing progress of programs, studies, leases on properties, and health care setting planning with recommendations and other data, as required.
* Develops and prepares standard methods and procedures for implementation of the maintenance systems and operations, construction contracts, and/or capital projects development. Provides technical assistance in review of existing maintenance and engineering procedures, service and construction contracts, and preventive maintenance for all System properties.
* Prepares reports that outline the scope and estimated cost of projects proposed, implemented, and developed. Develops and updates cost estimates.
* Analyzes construction phases and operating schedules to assure timely completion of projects with minimal disruption to surrounding activities and makes recommendations for workable and cost-effective solutions.
* Develops reports, studies, and surveys for senior leadership including new programs, statistical studies, leasing property, and health care setting planning. May make other recommendations and provide other data, as required.
* Ensures Life Safety for the facility and creates methodologies for meeting all regulatory requirements of all governing agencies.
* Serves as a consultant on issues relating to engineering, construction, and/or design projects as required by senior leadership. Liaises with Federal, State, and City agencies.
* Acts as a member of the Architect - Engineer Selection Board participating in the evaluation of prospective consultants for specific projects.
* Reviews budget submissions and provides recommendations regarding proposed projects and programs. Participates in regular periodic staff meetings.
* Participates in the annual operating budget; identifies and meets staffing needs to support service delivery. Ensures operations run within budgetary guidelines.
* Facilitates in-service training programs and provides orientation, training, and guidance to staff. Assesses staff training needs and evaluates the effectiveness of the program; implements changes to provide for more efficient operations. Oversees departmental processes for all required educational courses and certifications.
* May represent the System in certain legal matters dealing with City, State, and Federal agencies.
* Provides education on patient and public safety protocols and prevention techniques to staff, community members, patients and caregivers; in line with governing bodies.
* May assist with facilitation of the Workplace Violence Prevention Program in the absence of the Workplace Violence Prevention Coordinator.
* Participates in internal/external quality assurance/performance improvement (QA/Pl) activities and programs, training, and special studies, as required.
* Ensures ongoing compliance and maintenance of the NYC Health+ Hospitals policies with NYS standards and other applicable external regulatory guidelines and accreditation guidelines and standards.
* Performs other related duties, as directed.

Minimum Qualifications

1. A Baccalaureate Degree in Architecture, Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Construction Management or an approved related discipline from an accredited college or university; or,  
2. New York State licensure as a Registered Architect or Professional Engineer; and,  
3. Six years experience in the construction, architectural or engineering field, including three years in design contracts and construction contracts relating to health care facilities in a managerial or administrative capacity; or,  
4. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Department Preferences

Preference will be given to qualified candidates with the following knowledge, abilities, education, experience and/or skills:

* Designation as a Real Property Administrator (RPA) as conferred by the Buildings Owners and Managers Institute (BOMI), or
* A valid New York City High Pressure Boiler Operating Engineer license.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $145,000.00 - $168,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

title: Specialist, Claims Quality Regulatory Operations
description:
Hi, we're Oscar. We're hiring a Specialist, Claims Quality Regulatory Operations to join our Claims Quality team.



Oscar is the first health insurance company built around a full stack technology platform and a focus on serving our members. We started Oscar in 2012 to create the kind of health insurance company we would want for ourselves—one that behaves like a doctor in the family.


### **About the role**



The Specialist, Claims Regulatory Operations will support compliance within Provider Operations by coordinating responses, and delivering positive outcomes based on inputs from stakeholders. You will help advance compliance efforts by conducting detailed data analysis, supporting the preparation of Market Conduct Exam exhibits/narratives and the policies & procedures review process within Operations.



You will report to the Sr. Manager, Payment Quality.


**Work Location:**



Oscar is a blended work culture where everyone, regardless of work type or location, feels connected to their teammates, our culture and our mission.



If you live within commutable distance to our New York City office (in Hudson Square), our Tempe office (off the 101 at University Dr), or our Los Angeles office (in Marina Del Rey), you will be expected to come into the office at least two days each week. Otherwise, this is a remote / work-from-home role.



You must reside in one of the following states: Alabama, Arizona, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Carolina, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Virginia, Washington, or Washington, D.C. Note, this list of states is subject to change. #LI-Remote


**Pay Transparency:**



The base pay for this role in the states of California, Connecticut, New Jersey, New York, and Washington is: $69,600 - $91,350 per year. The base pay for this role in all other locations is: $62,640 - $82,215 per year. You are also eligible for employee benefits, participation in Oscar's unlimited vacation program and annual performance bonuses.


### **Responsibilities**


* Collaborate with team members and leaders to address process gaps and improvements.
* Review data pulls and conduct detailed analysis to support compliance initiatives.
* Develop trusting relationships with internal and external stakeholders through effective communication and collaboration.
* Draft detailed narratives and reports to communicate compliance findings and updates, including responses to Regulator/NCQA requests and examinations.
* Support creation of Policies & Procedures within Operations, ensuring that all policies and procedures are up-to-date and meet internal requirements as outlined by Compliance team.
* Assist in preparing for Market Conduct Exams and other regulatory reviews.
* Stay informed on business requirements and act on regulatory updates guided by Oscar's Compliance team to ensure adherence to effective processes and procedures
* Other duties as assigned
* Compliance with all applicable laws and regulations


### **Qualifications**


* Demonstrated understanding of Provider operations in the health payer industry.
* 1+ years of relevant experience working with operational compliance, regulatory, and data analysis within Healthcare Claims.
* 1+ years experience designing and improving workflows


### **Bonus Points**


* 1+ years experience working with regulatory bodies and Market Conduct Exams
* Regulatory experience
* Knowledge management, training, or content development in operational settings
* Process Improvement or Lean Six Sigma training
* 1+ years experience using data software (e.g. Excel, VGA, Macros, SQL and/or Python) to manipulate and analyze large data sets to solve business problems


This is an authentic Oscar Health job opportunity. Learn more about how you can safeguard yourself from recruitment fraud here.



At Oscar, being an Equal Opportunity Employer means more than upholding discrimination-free hiring practices. It means that we cultivate an environment where people can be their most authentic selves and find both belonging and support. We're on a mission to change health care - an experience made whole by our unique backgrounds and perspectives.


**Pay Transparency:** Final offer amounts, within the base pay set forth above, are determined by factors including your relevant skills, education, and experience. Full-time employees are eligible for benefits including: medical, dental, and vision benefits, 11 paid holidays, paid sick time, paid parental leave, 401(k) plan participation, life and disability insurance, and paid wellness time and reimbursements.


**Reasonable Accommodation:** Oscar applicants are considered solely based on their qualifications, without regard to applicant's disability or need for accommodation. Any Oscar applicant who requires reasonable accommodations during the application process should contact the Oscar Benefits Team (accommodations@hioscar.com) to make the need for an accommodation known.


**California Residents:** For information about our collection, use, and disclosure of applicants' personal information as well as applicants' rights over their personal information, please see our Notice to Job Applicants.
company_description: Healthcare is broken. We’re here to fix it. Come join us!

title: Director of Amazon Growth
description:
Director of Amazon Growth  

Remote  

ABOUT BARK



Here at BARK, we love dogs and their people. We're looking to make all dogs happy throughout the entire world (we're not kidding). Think Disney for dogs - we make magic for dogs and their people through our products, events, and experiences.



Our ambition level is high, the opportunity is huge, and our love for dogs is through the roof! We launched in 2011 with BarkBox, a monthly-themed subscription of all-natural treats and clever toys. Since then, we've shipped more than 70 million toys and treats to the dogs across the world and use all of that direct customer feedback to inform new initiatives and ways to make magic between dogs and their people. We've since expanded into other offerings as well, as we aim to become THE Dog Company for every family with a four-legged, belly-scratch-loving, interspecies family member.

  

THE TEAM  

The Growth team is responsible for scaling the organization through marketing and advertising. We are the engine that brings the company new customers in order to make ALL the dogs happy. Our team is close-knit - we like to have fun and joke around, and we're often found nerding out on consumer behavior. We offer a unique opportunity to be at the forefront of scaling BARK's presence and category leadership on Amazon. Competitive salary and benefits package, flexible working conditions, and the potential for significant career development. A collaborative and creative work environment where innovation, dog puns, and ideas are always welcomed. If you find the challenge of reaching new dog parents online (and elsewhere) fun, come join us! Also if you know a good dad joke or two, that's a plus.

  

WHO WE'RE SNIFFING FOR  

We are sniffing around for a dog & consumer-centric, entrepreneurial Director of Growth - Amazon who shares our dedication to making all dogs happy and has proven experience in delivering world-class growth. This pivotal role involves shaping the future of Bark's Marketplaces, developing marketing and growth strategies to enhance our product offerings, building awareness, reach, and scale. The ideal candidate is an expert in Sponsored Advertising, DSP, and Video, with a proven track record in managing budgets and complex catalogs. You will contribute to the strategy and execution of on- and off-platform paid media, collaborating with external agency partners to achieve marketing and sales goals. You will initiate and manage campaigns to enhance search engine visibility and drive shoppers to Amazon using paid tactics like paid social, search, display, retargeting, shopping, influencers, affiliates and Connected TV. If you're driven to create the best experience for dogs and their people, have experience building profitable businesses, please join us in scaling Amazon at BARK!


* Lead the media strategies across the Amazon channel to support business priorities, category objectives, communications calendar, and commercial goals
* Craft compelling integrated marketing campaigns focused on revenue growth and customer acquisition, optimizing the sales funnel from capture to customer retention, and enhancing marketing automation to improve conversion rate (CVR), average order value (AOV), lifetime value (LTV), and velocity.
* Create and iterate media scenarios with agency ad partners that are grounded in data, research, consumer trends, and best practices to deliver on multiple objectives and budget sizes.
* Collaborate with the team to improve product positioning, listing optimizations, promo strategies, post-purchase acquisition strategies and review acquisition.
* Oversee competitive positioning and pricing strategies to enhance market share and customer engagement.
* Utilize data-driven insights to continually refine marketing strategies, identifying opportunities for growth, acquisition, retention, and expansion across various marketing channels.
* Foster a culture of creativity, data-driven decision-making, and continuous improvement within the growth team.

  

  

EXPERIENCE


* 8+ years of experience leading growth and marketing on Amazon, Amazon International with demonstrated results in media strategy on and off the Amazon platform
* Proven track record of scaling a brand's Amazon revenue from $5 million to $50 million within a 3-year period. *Please include specific examples and results in your application.*
* Proven track record in launching and scaling Amazon international account. *Please include specific examples and results in your application*
* Demonstrable ability to manage complex projects and budgets effectively.
* Strong analytical skills, with a knack for turning data into actionable insights.
* A history of entrepreneurial, resourceful approaches to challenges, ideally within a startup or new product launch environment.


SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS


* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field (MBA preferred).
* Proven track record of success in senior growth/marketing leadership roles within Amazon
* Extensive performance marketing experience is required including hands-on experience with Search and DSP and a strong understanding of Amazon's algorithm and ranking factors.
* Familiarity with Amazon marketing stream, Amazon marketing cloud, vendor & seller central, advertising dashboard, downstream, and AI are desirable.
* Exceptional leadership and team management skills, with a history of building and motivating high-performing teams.
* Innovative thinker capable of operating in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, capable of building strong relationships across various stakeholders.
* Must be comfortable working independently in a small team setting where autonomy and self-sufficiency are crucial.
* Strong business acumen and strategic thinking, demonstrated by a history of fetching revenue growth and market expansion.
* Deep passion for our mission to make all dogs and their people happy with best-in-class CX throughout their journey from discovering BARK products to post-purchase engagement.
* Commitment to Innovation: BARK is dedicated to being at the forefront of artificial intelligence and is committed to driving advancements in this field. We are seeking individuals who share this passion and are enthusiastic about shaping the future of AI. Experience using AI tools is highly valued and openness to learning is a requirement.


FOR CO/NJ/NY BASED APPLICANTS:  

The base salary range for this position is $155,000-$240,000  

This position is eligible for equity

  

\\*\\*This compensation range is based on BARKs good faith estimate as of the date of this posting and may be modified in the future. Actual pay for this position will depend on a variety of variables including location, travel, internal equity, experience, education, skills and expertise.

  

  

At BARK, we believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates a richer experience for our employees and customers. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Therefore, we actively encourage applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, religions, genders, ages, sexual orientations, disabilities, veteran status, and other characteristics that make our team unique. If you share our passion for dogs and are excited about working in an inclusive environment where your individuality is celebrated, we want to hear from you! Experience with dogs is a plus, but all backgrounds and experiences are valued here.

title: LPN Supervisor - PT Weekends
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else’s life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You’ll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You’ll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal “hospitality with a higher purpose.” We know you’ll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*

***LPN- Licensed Practical Nurse***

We are seeking a compassionate and dedicated **LPN Supervisor** to oversee, mentor and nurture a team of nurses, HHA's, resident care aides and medication technicians in the busy Wellness/Resident Services Center of our luxury assisted living community. Acting as the shift supervisor in the absence of the Director, you will provide caring and attentive help to residents in managing their activities of daily living (ADLs) as well as in the administration of their medications — all while leading the team in caring for residents with skill and genuine kindness. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The loving care and professionalism you bring to the services you provide are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.

***LPN- Licensed Practical Nurse***

Additional responsibilities include:

* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Director of Wellness
* Must have staff supervisory and medication oversight experience, preferably in an assisted living, nursing home or similar environment
* You must have an active NY LPN certification and be driven by a genuine desire to improve the quality of life of our residents
* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be caring, reliable and observant with an understanding of MAR’s and doctors' orders
* It’s essential to excel in prioritizing, multi-tasking and working independently

***LPN- Licensed Practical Nurse***

Job Types: Part-time, Per diem

Pay: $30.00 - $34.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus opportunities

Ability to Relocate:

* Jericho, NY 11753: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person
